Articles.Content:
dia 24/06/2020

quarta-feira de kerbin

a ksp fez uma encomenda de 400 propulsores, e a empresa periapsis (a que eles pediram a encomenda) esta do outro lado do planeta e não existe uma infraestrutura para a empresa levar os 400 propulsores.
eles não são uma boa empresa de encomendas, mas a ksp escolheu eles para a encomenda, e eles precisam agora.
e a ksp mandou uma data para eles chegarem, pois a prodobordyne também quer ter o espaço.
então eles tiveram que usar o caminhão mais rápido deles: o crater c7.
eles iam ter que passar pelo deserto kerbineano.
e ainda eles iam ter de passar pelos polos gelados de kerbin.

dia 25/06/2020

quinta-feira de kerbin

o crater c7 estava abastecido e preparado, e agora já estava pronto para fazer a jornada.
mas ainda tinha um problema: será que o combustível aguenta?
o diretor da periapsis disse que aguentava, então eles foram.

a ksp estava ficando preucupada com os propulsores e para piorar a prodobordyne já lançou um foguete para o deserto (acredita-se que eles querem acertar o crater c7)
o crater c7 estava ainda a 3330 km da ksp.
e o piloto do crater c7 viu algo parecido com um sol, mas esse sol estava se mexendo.
era o míssil da prodobordyne!!!

eles viram algo estranho, por isso, aumentaram a velocidade e o míssil quase acertou mas ele caiu mais atras do caminhão

5 DIAS DEPOIS

eles chegaram na ksp, mas o caminhão não aguentava mais, então a ksp deu lhes um curso de aviões e também deram um avião.
foi assim que a k consegui entrar em órbita com o satelita periapsis 1 ( em uma homenagem a empresa que lhe deu os propulsores)

5 hours ago, gaelcurto said:

Google Translate:

day 24/06/2020

kerbin wednesday

ksp placed an order for 400 thrusters, and the periapsis company (the one they ordered) is on the other side of the planet and there is no infrastructure for the company to take the 400 thrusters.
they are not a good ordering company, but ksp chose them for ordering, and they need it now.
and ksp sent a date for them to arrive, because prodobordyne also wants to have the space.
so they had to use their fastest truck: the c7 crater.
they were going to have to go through the Kerbinean desert.
and yet they were going to have to go through the cold kerbin poles.

day 25/06/2020

kerbin thursday

Crater C7 was fueled and prepared, and was now ready to make the journey.
but I still had a problem: can the fuel hold up?
the director of periapsis said he could take it, so they went.

the ksp was getting worried about the thrusters and to make the prodobordyne worse it has already launched a rocket into the desert (it is believed that they want to hit the c7 crater)
the c7 crater was still 3330 km from the ksp.
and the pilot of the C7 crater saw something like a sun, but that sun was moving.
it was the prodobordyne missile !!!

they saw something strange, so they increased the speed and the missile almost hit but it fell further behind the truck

5 DAYS LATER

they arrived at ksp, but the truck couldn't take it anymore, so ksp gave them an airplane course and also gave them a plane.
that's how k managed to get into orbit with the satellite periapsis 1 (in a tribute to the company that gave it the thrusters)

 

Hey @gaelcurto, wlecome to the forums.  Outside of the International section of the forums, we ask that you include an English translation to your posts.  

As this appears to be a mission report, thread has been moved to Mission Reports.
